page.title: 15Local Government
page.content: Six Councillors are elected every four years to both Cabus and Scorton Parish Council.Cabus meet every eight weeks and Scorton every six.A Clerk is employed by both to keep their records,which are available for inspection by parishioners.Council's observations on all planning applications in their parishes are passed on to the Borough Planning Officer.Complaints, requests for improved services are forwarded to the relevant Authority at local and County level.Cabus precepts the Rating Authority for the cost of running the Parish and insurance on equipment.In addition Scorton precepts for maintenance on its playing fields,War Memorial and half the rates of the Public Hall,then the Borough Treasurer determines the rate to be levied.
